overview: Personal memory exists to the extent that it is shaped by the individual's own time and place. Proust states that it is a re-creation of the past by saying "memories developed by the mind", Even if the state of forgetting is inevitable, the form of the past changes with the images in the consciousness. In the short film, the director examines the interaction with memory, time, and space in a visual context, using different media, based on the daily life and encounters of her grandmother, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's 15 years ago.
title: Faces
